discussion.content: Click Rates: Measure the overall click rate of your organization. When you first roll out phishing training this number will drop fast, perhaps from a 20% click rate to less than 2% click rate for more basic phishing templates. Once you are at around 2-3% click rate you may need to start using more difficult / targeted phishing templates. Most phishing vendors support a tiered approach enabling you to use different categories of phishing difficulty. Remember, your goal is not a 0% click rate, as once you hit 2% or less click rate with basic, beginner level phishing lures, your first-time clickers are primarily new hires, and this is a training event for them.

While following system hardening standards (option D) is an important aspect of maintaining application security, it is a specific subset within the broader framework of configuration management. Ensuring proper change control is foundational to maintaining the integrity, reliability, and security of applications over time, making it the primary reason for implementing a configuration management process.

C. To ensure proper change control

Configuration management processes help ensure that changes made to applications are controlled, documented, and implemented in a systematic manner. This helps maintain the stability, reliability, and security of the applications while minimizing the risk of unintended consequences from changes. While optimization of system resources (Option A), asset management workflows (Option B), and adherence to system hardening standards (Option D) are important aspects, they are secondary to the core objective of ensuring proper change control in the configuration management process.
